text.value: Section A: Demographic characteristics of the respondent
A5. Years of experience in the field
A6. Years of experience in the current position
Years of exp in current position is required
B1. Are you familiar with any of the terms One Health / Diseases Surveillance System / intersectional coordination / Event Based Surveillance
B.2 Is there any department /unit in your organization currently operating/ dealing with One Health or intersectoral related functions?
If Yes from above, please Write Name
B.3 Which section / unit is responsible or looking after for One Health coordination / surveillance system in your department/organization?
B.4 One Health Guidelines / SOPs are available, if yes please provide copy.
B.5 Are there some TORs / Scope of Work for OH department/unit? (Please provide copy)
B.6 Is there some designated Focal Person or staff working for OH promotion or related subject
If yes from above, Provide names and contact details

C1. SOPs for interdepartmental / sectoral coordination are available for all levels with clear guidance on data collection, reporting, aggregation, processing, transmission, analysis, dissemination and quality assurance of the data.
C.2 There is a demonstrated commitment available for OH promotion in department at multiple levels (Central / Province / District / Unit)
C.3 With which Ministry other department or agency you tend to collaborate or usually liaise for technical or administrative matters?
C4 The Managers are autonomous enough to determine their own information/data needs and have sufficient authority to take decisions for using data as per the objective of the department or system?
D.1 Do you know if there is some Ministry / Department already designated to take overall / inter-departmental coordination role/lead for OH promotion?
D.2 Are there some clear TORs assigned to Intersectoral coordinating unit. Yes (Please provide copy).

D.3 There is some separate budgetary support by Government or Partners for development of One Health Program/intersectoral coordination. Or work either through development or non-development budget (e.g. PC-1 etc.). If yes, provide more detail.
If yes from above, provide more details
D.4 Is there a National / provincial Laboratory (NL) for OH surveillance system in the area of Human, Animal, Food, Poultry and Environment etc.?
If yes from above, Please provide list with major functions
D.5 Please Tick from following diseases that your National or Provincial Laboratory (NRL) is capable for sample collection, Lab Analysis & final result
D.6 Are there some regular meetings/reviews being organized or in past organized on OH or related issues. (Please provide evidence/reference)
D.7 Do you know if up to date/annual assessment of OH project has been organized? (If yes, plz provide reference below)
If yes on D.7, plz provide reference
D.8 Do you know if up to date/annual assessment of HR has been organized? (If yes, plz provide reference)
If yes on D.8, plz provide reference
D.9 Challenges, Opportunities/Options & Recommendations for OH Promotion / Intersectoral Coordination (Please provide necessary information against sub-topics)
Please provide necessary information against sub-topics
E.1 There is up-to-date regulatory mechanism (adhoc or regular) among sectors for data exchange or sharing for OH diseases/issues.
E.2 There are regular SOPs/Protocols in place for OH coordination for data collection and consolidation.
E.3 The routine information collection and use component is integrated in overall sector plan or part of some project documents reflected under M&E framework.
E.4 Is there any standardized training curriculum / Manual available for MIS / Surveillance system?
E.5 Is there any training plan for One Health MIS / Surveillance system? If yes, plz specify below
If yes from E.5, please specify
SECTION F. Data Collection / Surveillance system in Place
F.1. Is there any uniform Surveillance / MIS System / database (IT Software/ MIS) currently operating at Federal / provincial or district level?
F.2. Is there any list of facility / data collecting unit available from where data is being collected?
F.3. Is there any data collection tools (software/APP) currently used to collect information direct from communities
SECTION F: Software/App Currently used to collect data from community
No of data collectors is required
F.3.4 Type of data is collected
Type of data collected is required
F.4. Is there Call centre for events and rumors reporting?
F.4.2 Infrastructure used – make, model, software
F.4.5 Number of call center agents
F.4.6 What type of data is collected
F.5. Is there media scanning center currently in use
SECTION F: Media Scanning Centre details
F.5.1 Location of Media Scanning centre
Please quantify eg TV(6), Radios (1), Laptop (4) etc
F.5.4 Number of personnel running center
G.1. What types of (Plz circle; Human Health/ Animal Health/Environment Health/Food Security) System / database are in place. List down as per below mentioned details: (Provide briefs)
G.2 How the data is being shared from multiple data sources at various level (Federal /Provincial/District). Information / Data Flow diagram? (If available, plz provide copy)
(Mention whether Computer application or Manual system)
(Mention whether Computer application or Manual system)
(Mention whether Computer application or Manual system)
(Mention whether Computer application or Manual system)
SECTION H. Data Management / Reporting & Feedback
H.1 Human Health/Animal Health/Environment Health/Food Security data (paper or electronic) are stored appropriately and according to some standard protocols.
H.2 Data collection systems for client data (e.g. clinical episodes) are standardized across all implementing partners and departments.
H.3 Data transmission to the next level occurs in a timely way, making use of innovation and IT

H.4. Is there a mechanism of Feedback in place and systematically provided to all sub-reporting units on the quality of their reporting (i.e. accuracy, completeness and timeliness) and use of data for decision-making based on their submitted reports.
H.5 There are clear policies and guidelines for adequate storage of aggregate reports (paper or electronic) at different levels (national, provincial).
H.6 There is an integrated, on-line national data repository to store and maintain the all aggregated data and to enable online data entry, effective data analysis and use.
SECTION J. Data Quality Assurance / ICT framework
J.1 Data quality assurance plan is developed and shared to guide stakeholders in improving the reported data quality.
J.2 Data quality improvement plans are developed, implemented and monitored to address quality problems identified in the assessments

J.3 There is a national /provincial policy for routine Human Health/ Animal Health / Environment Health information governing the acquisition and use of ICT that is adhered to by the reporting entities.
J.4 There is an adequate ICT (e.g. computers, internet connection, telemedicine, telephones, computer networks etc.) appropriately used.
J.5 There is adequate provision for maintenance (e.g. backups, antivirus protection, etc.) and troubleshooting of the ICT resources at each level.
J.6 Human Health / Animal Health / Environment Health / Food Security information systems are interoperable (i.e. data can be shared between systems) at the same level.
J.7 There are printed guidelines available for peripheral facilities (and are applicable community-based programs) to assist in data compilation and reporting.
J.8 Data disaggregation by key stratifies (age, sex, geography or some other) are maintained during compilation and transfer in order to permit equity analysis.
J.9 Data transfer to the next level occurs in a timely way, making use of innovation and IT where appropriate and available.
SECTION K. Community-Based Service Data (Outbreak / Pandemic info only)
K.1 Community-based information needs are defined according to a community needs or sectoral strategy.

K.2 A minimum set of community-based indicators (with standard definitions, appropriate disaggregation and frequency of collection) have been developed to monitor the implementation of community-based interventions.
K.3 The design of the health/animal facility and community information systems include input from end users and other key stakeholders at all levels.
K.4 Community based interventions and data are appropriately linked to health/animal facilities to facilitate management, oversight and reporting.
k.5 The facility-based information system is interoperable with other systems at various levels.
SECTION L. Other Surveillance & Response Aspects
L.1 There are adequate Human Resources and laboratory capacity for surveillance and response to notifiable diseases.
L2. The department / agency has adequate capacity to diagnose and record cases of notifiable diseases.
L3. Epidemic preparedness and response plans are in place with distinct procedures, rapid response teams and contingency stocks of drugs, vaccines, reagents and supplies
L.4 There are mechanisms in place for effective risk communication during a public health emergency.
L.5 Is there any regular system for progress review meeting / supervision / Monitoring & Evaluation? (Plz provide evidence)
If yes from L.5 above please provide evidence
L.6 A report of health/facility statistics is produced regularly i.e. monthly, biannually or annually?
L.7 A culture of information use is promoted by policy leaders and decision-makers and reflected in the use of facility & community-based data in planning, monitoring and evaluation reports.

L.8 Is there some event bases surveillance (EBS) is in place e.g. reporting of potential events by Health Workers, Farmers, Media Reporting for detection of diseases or early warning? If so, please provide more detail
If yes from L.8, please provide more detail.
L.9 Is there any arrangement for exchange of disease information either inter-district, inter-province or transboundary
L.10 Challenges, Opportunities/Options & Recommendations for OH Promotion / Intersectoral Coordination (Please provide necessary information against sub-topics)
